content.description: This is the tighter "back" corridor face. On the left side of the face look for the vertical right-facing sidepull rail feature. Sit start matched here and toss right to the diagonal slash. From the slash, work up to the enormous round pinch and up to the high ledge. mantle and jump down.

Not actually on the Shotgun Boulder but when in the corridor this is on the cliffline face beside Shotgun. 

  Stand start in front of the Rhodo at the blunt arete corner. Start on edges mid-face and climb the ripples and edges to the ledge top out below the high upper roof. Walk over and right to the runnel to downclimb off.
content.location: Shotgun Boulder, the face to the right of the corridor.

content.description:
To the far left face of the inner corridor section, find the shorter juggy face. 

  Sit start on deep in-cuts and work up chunky face holds to the flat top. Top out and walk over to the block back face to downclimb the downhill side step-like face (as per Buckshot).

A very pretty line that runs to the right of Buckshot. 

  Look under the steep face in the back portion of the corridor face of the boulder.  

  Below the overhung, blunt arete to the right of Buckshot look for the low edges to stand start on. 

  Work up and right to larger flat ledges, jugs and nice holds to the top. Walk off as per Buckshot.

An all star line.Â To the right of Triumph follow the obvious crack line down and right. Sit start under the boulder on the low jug ledge just left of the detached fin/block. Move into the crack and follow it left. Follow crack diagonally to top out at ledge and jump down.
To the low right of the standard start of "Triumph" stand start on a thin gaston crimp (right hand) and a low thin undercling crimp (left hand). Work left into and finish as per "Triumph"

A wild sky mantle on a beautiful boulder.On the front-most face look to the left under the huge roof. Stand start low on the bottom of the back face in very low underclings. Stand up to the chunky features left of the huge hueco. Follow jugs up and under the roof to make a huge move out and right to the lip. Work right across the jug ledge at the lip, then mantle that ledge. Stand up and once able to stand with no hands, hop down to pads.

A classic layback line. 

  In the corridor face look for the proud fin/crack line.  

  Stand start at the jug lip of the low ledge. Work into the fin of the crack feature and layback the rounded thin arete edge. Use the face features where available and climb up to the protruding upper point/lobe. Top out and walk off to the far end to the blocky backside to downclimb the downhill side step-like face.

On the corridor, this is the uphill-most arete.Sit start with your left hand sidepulling the long nice rail, right hand on anything low to compress. Work up arete with nice iron features and mantle midway up to journey into dirty terrail and rhodos, or just jump down to pads.

Beyond the Mausoleum Boulder walk over to where the cliff line picks back up. There is a broken section of cliff that has become the Shotgun Boulder. You can walk behind the boulder and find climbs all the way around it through its corridors. The side of the boulder houses a wonderful high roof.
